law.catch_line: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated....

text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Bank" has the meaning stated in 12 U.S.C. § 1841(c).
"Bank holding company" has the meaning stated in 12 U.S.C. § 1841(a).

section.section: "Beneficiary" means a person who receives or is entitled as a matter of right to receive a current distribution of principal or income from a trust, estate, or fund with respect to which a substitution of a corporate fiduciary is made under this subtitle.

"Beneficiary" includes:
If the beneficiary is a minor, the beneficiary's natural or legal guardian; or
If the beneficiary is a disabled person, as defined in § 13-101 of this article, any person acting on behalf of the beneficiary under a guardianship, conservatorship, or committee.

text.section: "Capital requirement" means a provision in any court order, statute, regulation, or writing, including a will, trust, or similar document or instrument, that requires a fiduciary to have a specified minimum amount of capital or capital and surplus.

"Corporate fiduciary" means:
A bank;
A trust company; or
Any other corporate entity that is authorized to act as a fiduciary under the laws of this State.
"Trust company" has the meaning stated in § 1-101 of this article.
